title: Pivot Tables for Portfolio Analysis
content:
# Pivot Tables for Portfolio Analysis

Pivot tables are powerful for reshaping data, especially when dealing with 'Long' format data (common in databases) vs 'Wide' format (common in matrices).

## Long Format
`Date | Ticker | Price`

## Wide Format
`Date | AAPL | GOOG | MSFT`

Converting Long to Wide makes correlation analysis much easier.

```python
df.pivot(index='Date', columns='Ticker', values='Price')
```
code:
import pandas as pd

data = {
    'Date': ['2023-01-01', '2023-01-01', '2023-01-02', '2023-01-02'],
    'Ticker': ['AAPL', 'GOOG', 'AAPL', 'GOOG'],
    'Price': [150, 2800, 152, 2810]
}
df_long = pd.DataFrame(data)

# Pivot to Wide format
df_wide = df_long.pivot(index='Date', columns='Ticker', values='Price')

print("Long Format:")
print(df_long)
print("\nWide Format:")
print(df_wide)
